description: Composite numbers with an odd number of prime factors (counted with multiplicity).
example: a(1)=8 as 8=2*2*2, that is 8 is a composite integer and having 3 (an odd number) prime factors.
mathematica: fQ[n_] := Block[{p = Plus @@ Last /@ FactorInteger@n}, OddQ[p] && p > 1]; Select[ Range@200, fQ[ # ] &] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Jan 04 2006 *)
prog: (PARI) is(n)=!isprime(n) && bigomega(n)%2 \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Sep 17 2015
author: _Patrick De Geest_, Jun 15 1998
